page.title: 20Northill Village Tea Room
page.content: In the Spring of 1984, a number of local housewives, concerned about the closure of village amenities, started a fortnightly{TEA ROOM}in the Village Hall. Its aim was, and is, to provide a focal point for villagers to meet in a relaxed and informal setting. Tea and home-made cakes are the usual fare, and gradually, stall-holders selling stationery, produce, crafts & bread have come along, which, together with a raffle, create an interesting afternoon. Support for the TEA ROOM has been enthusiastic, and the organisers won the 1984{'VILLAGE VENTURES'} competition run by the Bedfordshire Rural Community Council. This is a non-profit making initiative which has become a regular feature of village life.
